part.narration: Sunday. Again. Akihabara. Yuki is at the video game store. She chats up the Cashier, a Frenchman.
part.line: Sir what would you say is the demographic for this game?
Oh, darn. Let me go look for another.
part.narration: Yuki gets another game.She winks at the Player and urges her to look for another game. The Player can continue to pull games from the shelf, but the result stays the same.
part.line: So the main demographic for nearly every video game is nerdy boys.
It's been improving. One time I saw a 36 year old man playing a handheld.
Improvement is when the medium knows not age nor gender.
What if I told you I don't play video games?
What if I told you I don't listen to music?
And now, we understand the social stigma behind video games.
part.narration: Sudden cut to Yuki, walking outside.Yuki is just outside of the game shop, near the train station.
